textos_fuente.text: 31st Season Virtual Announcement Party | The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse Skip to main content The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse Menu (321) 636-5050 Buy Tickets Gift Account Cart 31st Season Virtual Announcement Party 30th Season (2019-2020) Jul 31 WHEN: Friday, July 31 at 7:30 pm WHERE AND HOW TO WATCH: The LIVE stream will be available to view online on the following platforms: Facebook - The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse (CVP) YouTube - HistoricCVP ABOUT THE VIRTUAL ANNOUNCEMENT PARTY: The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse is once again distinguishing itself by producing a film to document and commemorate its 30th Season of Operation and announce its plans for its 31st Season of Broadway on Brevard. The Playhouse has long held a reputation for stellar production quality in Brevard County, and it plans to continue its commitment to live theatre in a changing world. It will announce its plans for its 31st Season programming on July 31st, 2020 at 7 PM in a short film highlighting its performances and performers throughout the past season. “Our goal with this is to not only announce our 31st Season, but also to let our performers and audiences know that we are thinking of them, we miss them, and we hope that they are safe until we see each other again,” says Chief Executive Officer, Dr. Anastacia Hawkins-Smith. “We hope that Playhouse regulars and volunteers will tune in with their loved ones, as well as, anyone who has a periphery knowledge of our theatre, and by the end of the broadcast we are confident that we will leave viewers with a heart full of hope.” The film will be available to view across multiple media including on the Playhouse’s website, official FaceBook and YouTube. The broadcast is replacing the “Announcement Party” that the Playhouse has held each year and has become a staple of the theatre community. The virtual “Announcement Party” will share some of the beloved memories of the past year as well as a sneak peek in the future, which staff members are confident will surprise anyone familiar with the Playhouse’s format and programming. Hawkins-Smith continues confidently, “I believe people will be surprised with our plans and am so excited to bring some new and different ideas to the community in addition to meeting our patrons expectations. The most important thing about this virtual party is that I want everyone to know that wherever they are in their life, they are not alone—we are here for you.” The “Virtual 31st Season Announcement Party” is free and can be streamed online at CocoaVillagePlayhouse.com or on any of the Playhouse’s social media platforms on July 31st at 7 PM. WIN PRIZES WHILE YOU WATCH: We are excited to be hosting TWO contests that will run during the live streaming of our Virtual Announcement Party. The first is an At-Home Red Carpet Fashion Show where two lucky winners will receive a set of Season Tickets. Dress in your fanciest party attire and upload a photo of you (and any participating friends and family) onto Facebook and/or Instagram using the hashtag #CVPFashionShow and tag us on FB @The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse (CVP) and Instagram @historic_cvp The other contest will be our “31 Winners to Celebrate 31 Seasons of Broadway on Brevard.” All you have to do is comment during the LIVE stream on Facebook telling us what your favorite show has been over the last 30 years at the playhouse. Every comment posted during the LIVE stream starting at 7pm until it ends will automatically be entered to win one of our various prizes, which will include gift certificates to the playhouse, as well as, certificates from other Cocoa Village merchants. All winners will be randomly selected and announced by the following day, Saturday, August 1st, 2020. Volunteer Opportunities | The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse Skip to main content The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse Menu (321) 636-5050 Buy Tickets Gift Account Cart Volunteer Opportunities The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse is well known for having a dedicated team of volunteers that assist in keeping the theatre in operation. There are many different and diverse volunteer opportunities that help maintain our status of Broadway on Brevard. If you are interested in joining our team, we invite you to explore some of the opportunities listed below. Costuming The costuming department plays a vital role in creating the overall essence of a show. Costumes are an important storytelling tool that help create character and build on the development of any performance. Through the hard work of dedicated volunteers, The Playhouse prides itself with the opportunity to hand make and create all the costumes that appear on our stage. Whether it be sewing, ironing, crafting, or helping maintain our inventory, there is a place for any skill set in our costume shop. For more information about how to volunteer in our costuming department, contact Marsha, Sewing Room Manager, at: marshaCVP@gmail.com . Performing Arts Being a part of the performing arts within the community can be a wonderful and life changing experience. Regardless of the level of training and experience in the arts, we welcome everyone to join us for auditions at the theatre. Our volunteer performers consist of people in our community from all walks of life, including teachers, students, health care works, and military. Our volunteer performers help preserve and maintain a high professional quality of arts within the community. For more information on upcoming auditions, we invite you to visit our Auditions page . Front of House From checking tickets to helping patrons find their seat, Front of House is an essential part of any production at the Playhouse. Ushers play an important role in the audience experience as representatives of our historic theatre and serve as the first impression that patrons encounter as they attend a performance. Volunteers in Front of House maintain an image of excellence while carrying a friendly and professional composure. Ushers must be a minimum of 16 years of age or older. For more information about how to volunteer in our Front of House department, contact Nathaniel, Front of House Manager at: CVPUshering@gmail.com . 100th Celebration | The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse Skip to main content The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse Menu (321) 636-5050 Buy Tickets Gift Account Cart 100th Celebration The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse is a timeless gem that has been enchanting audiences for nearly a century! As we eagerly await the grand celebration of our 100th-year anniversary in 2024, we invite you to join us on this exhilarating journey down memory lane and into the future. For more information on our historic theatre, we invite you to learn more about our History . Since opening a century ago in 1924, The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse has been a beacon of art, culture, and community in the heart of Cocoa Village. Originally “The Aladdin Theatre”, generations of theater enthusiasts have graced our walls, and each performance has left an indelible mark on the hearts of both performers and spectators alike. As we approach this momentous milestone, we are thrilled to announce that our team is diligently preparing an array of spectacular events and surprises that will make our centennial celebration an experience like no other. As cherished members of our community, we consider you an integral part of this journey. Mark your calendars, spread the word, and let the anticipation begin. Our 100th-year anniversary celebration begins on August 17, 2024, with a Diamond Gala which will be a once-in-a-lifetime event that will leave you spellbound and touched by the magic of theater. We invite you to keep checking this page for updates as we unfold surprises and announcements all season long! Thank you for being a cherished part of The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse family – we can't wait to share this extraordinary milestone with you! *Below would be a list of events for the 100th as they are prepared, the first being for the Diamond Gala August 2024. This page should act as a beginning landing page that will continuously be updated throughout the 35th season as events and things are updated. History of the Playhouse | The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse Skip to main content The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse Menu (321) 636-5050 Buy Tickets Gift Account Cart History of the Playhouse Established as the Aladdin Theater, the doors opened to the public on August 18th, 1924, showing silent movies. Later, Brevard’s first “talkie” movie house became known as “the showplace of the Indian River Section”. Several owners and several decades later, the building was purchased by the City of Cocoa and renamed The Cocoa Village Playhouse. In August of 1984, Brevard Community College District Board of Trustees acquired the building for $1 with the understanding that the college would take the responsibility of ownership and make the theatre operate in the best interest of the community. The Trustees immediately established a 501(c)(3) not for profit Direct Support Organization with its own Board of Directors who were given the responsibility of raising funds to make the Playhouse self-supporting. Through donations from individuals, organizations, corporations and grants from Foundations, as well as the State of Florida, the Playhouse was restored, made operational, and began producing community based musicals in 1989 featuring local volunteer performers. In 1991, the Playhouse was accepted onto the National Register of Historic Places in Tallahassee and the official corporate name became The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse, Inc. As the programming grew and became popular, the Stars of Tomorrow youth program was established in 1992 beginning with eight young people and now has over 250 participants each season featuring youth ages 7 through high school graduation. The program instructs them in not only the performing arts but life management skills as each “Star” is required to maintain a 3.0 grade point average in their classes. The performer base has now grown to over 600 volunteers who rotate throughout the productions each year with a core group known as the “Gold Star Performers” who perform in consecutive performances each season. An audience base of 2,100 season patrons support the Playhouse each year and performances are known to sell out to the public before the run of each production is finished. Over 55,000 audience viewers participate each year. Due to the growth of the programs, a Capital Campaign was conducted to raise $1.9 million dollars to build a Technical Support Annex on the property east of the historic building. The property was donated by Harrison Vanderslice. The construction of the three story Technical Support Annex was completed in 2008 and immediately became fully operational providing a scenic workshop, a costume construction area, expanded dressing rooms, a designated hair and makeup area, and a rehearsal studio. In the Spring of 2011, Brevard Community College returned ownership of the Playhouse to the City of Cocoa. Theatrical operations continued to be managed by the same 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization, The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse, Inc., while The City of Cocoa took the responsibility of maintaining the building. The City and the Playhouse jointly undertook a dynamic million-dollar renovation project resulting in the Playhouse opening its 23rd season on September 28, 2012 with a newly renovated auditorium, expanded orchestra pit, and enlarged balcony. The auditorium is now considered one of the most beautiful theatres in Florida. A $500,000 renovation project in the summer of 2014 funded by a Cultural Facilities Grant through the State of Florida was completed to upgrade the lobby and mezzanine areas of the theatre. In 2016, the Board of Directors took the opportunity to purchase the historic R.M. Rembert Building adjacent to the south of the Playhouse. A capital campaign will be launched in 2018 for the restoration and renovation of the Rembert Building which was built in 1910. It is intended for this acquisition to better serve our patrons and assist in the mission of the Playhouse. Known to all as “Broadway on Brevard”, this team of volunteers and staff are truly an example of one of the highest quality community theatres in our country. 31st Season (2020 – 2021) | The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse Skip to main content The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse Menu (321) 636-5050 Buy Tickets Gift Account Cart 31st Season (2020 – 2021) Season Ticket Order Form - 31st Season (2020 – 2021) Stars of Tomorrow Season Ticket Order Form - 31st Season (2020 – 2021) For more information about tickets, visit our box office page . Watch the 31st Season Virtual Announcement Party Procedures to Keep You Safe As the Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse once again opens its doors to audiences, we are doing everything we can do keep our audiences, performers and staff safe. Here are a few procedures we have in place to keep you safe... Closure of will call to minimize unnecessary crowds Check your tickets for your seats Upon arrival, queue on the south side of the theatre noting the ground markings Please bring your own facial covering and wear to the theatre, we will provide you with a mask if you do not have one Your temperature will be taken upon arrival If you are experiencing any symptoms, we will issue you a gift certificate for a future performance Upon entry, please make use of our hand sanitizing stations Concessions and raffles will be suspended for the interim, however we will provide you with complimentary bottles of water at designated stations Programs will be found on the table to the left of your entry to the auditorium There will be no intermission, please locate the restroom nearest your seat Please follow the posted signage to maintain a one-way flow of traffic Designated arrival time for seating Limited seating based on social distancing policies to make sure each reservation is safe Our cast will not be greeting audiences after the show Spraying of all surfaces with industrial antiviral/antibacterial solution prior to audience members arrival Thank you for your help in keeping us all safe and for supporting this historic theatre. If you have any questions or concerns please contact us at The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse 300 Brevard Avenue, Cocoa, FL 32922 321-636-5050 Main navigation About Us Meet the Team 100th Celebration History Contact Us Business Partners Show History Box Office Ticketing Information Season Subscriptions Seating Chart Plan Your Visit Buy Tickets Online Gift Certificates Donate to the Playhouse Events Broadway on Brevard Spotlight Series Stars of Tomorrow 100th Celebration Auditions College Audition Prep Studio Get Involved Job Opportunities Volunteer Opportunities Audition Information Sponsorship Opportunities The Aladdin Society The Legacy Foundation Student Scholarships The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse, Inc. provides affordable community theatre and promotes lifelong education in the performing arts for Brevard County residents and visitors. Experience Broadway on Brevard | The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse Skip to main content The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse Menu (321) 636-5050 Buy Tickets Gift Account Cart Front Menu About Us Box Office Performances Get Involved Experience Broadway on Brevard Located in beautiful downtown Cocoa Village, the Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse provides affordable community theatre and promotes lifelong education in the performing arts for Brevard County residents and visitors. With its family of local performers and technical staff, the Playhouse’s full line up of Broadway Musicals have earned it the nickname “Broadway on Brevard”. 36th Season Broadway on Brevard Season Ticket Form 36th Season Spotlight Series, Stars, Audition Information Authorized Ticket Sales Please be advised. In order to protect the public from any and all fraudulent activity, the Playhouse prohibits the reselling of tickets through third party sellers or markets. Many ticket resellers such as StubHub, Seat Geek, Vivid Seats, Tickets-Center and others offer tickets at highly inflated prices. All hard tickets and e-tickets have the original face value of the ticket printed on them. Additionally, we post our tickets prices on all advertising materials and here on our website. If you see tickets for sale higher than our advertised prices, please inform us and we will do what we can to have those tickets removed. Tickets found to be advertised for resale may be invalidated. Patrons attempting to use these invalidated tickets will not be admitted to events without purchasing a valid ticket through the Playhouse Box Office. WHEN YOU BUY FROM SOMEONE OTHER THAN THE PLAYHOUSE BOX OFFICE OR SPEKTRIX ONLINE TICKETING SERVICE: We cannot guarantee that your tickets are genuine. You almost always will pay more than face value. We cannot replace lost or stolen tickets. We cannot contact you with information on show cancellations, time changes, road closures or traffic updates, upcoming shows or other useful information. You are supporting businesses that make it harder for true fans to see their favorite performers without paying a premium charge. Please always check that you are buying directly from The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse box office. When purchasing tickets via CocoaVillagePlayhouse.com, you will continue to our secure ticketing site, via our online ticketing company, Spektrix. Any other website you are on is NOT an authorized Cocoa Village Playhouse site. Current Playhouse production cast members are authorized to reserve and distribute tickets for Playhouse events. Tickets acquired from current cast members will be valid. No other outlets are authorized or supported. Auditions for Little Women | The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse Skip to main content The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse Menu (321) 636-5050 Buy Tickets Gift Account Cart Auditions for Little Women 31st Season (2020-2021) Oct 11 - Oct 12 WHEN: Live On-site Auditions at The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse Sunday, October 11 at 6:30 pm Monday, October 12 at 7pm (Must be 13 years or older to audition for this production) Virtual auditions will also be accepted and must be received by Sunday, Oct. 11 at 12 noon WHERE: The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse 300 Brevard Avenue • Cocoa •  FL 32922 VIRTUAL AUDITION PREPARATION: If you are opting to audition with us virtually this season, please follow the instructions below. No Experience Necessary, we will train you! Record a video of your audition song and upload it to YouTube, Dropbox, Google Drive or another video hosting site that is easy to access and view publicly. Make sure that your video audition is 16 bars of music or no longer than 1 minute in length. Reminder to make sure that your video is set to public viewing. It is important that we hear your vocals in your video, so please make sure that you are singing with live accompaniment or pre-recorded background music only and not singing along with another pre-recorded vocalist. Please, NO a capella (singing without instrumental accompaniment) auditions for this production. We need to hear how you are on pitch with accompanied music. Send an active link to view your video to CVPauditions@gmail.com with “ Attn: Little Women Audition ” as the headline. CLICK HERE to fill out and submit an online Audition Application You will be contacted via email when we receive your video and information and are able to view your audition with any further instructions, if required. Virtual auditions for LITTLE WOMEN must be received by October 11 at 12 noon. If you are called back for a principal role, you will be asked to join us in person at the Playhouse for those dates ( Note: Callback auditions are closed to the public ) AUDITION PREPARATION FOR LIVE ON-SITE AUDITIONS: No Experience Necessary, we will train you! On-site audition dates for LITTLE WOMEN are Oct. 11 at 6:30pm and Oct. 12 at 7pm You will be required to wear a face mask and have your temperature checked to enter the theatre. Please keep a socially safe distance while in the theatre waiting to audition. Please limit vocal auditions to a maximum of 1 minute or 16 bars of music. Sheet music Is preferred (We provide a pianist). CD, Flash Drive or MP3 accompaniment must not contain pre-recorded vocals and must stop at 1 minute.  No smart phones or iPods/tablets, please. Flash drives with MP3 files are accepted at auditions as well. If you do not have a prepared song, you will be asked to sing “Happy Birthday” with the piano accompaniment (a pianist will be provided) No a capella (singing without instrumental accompaniment) vocals, please. You will also be given stage movement and/or dance to follow, unless noted under the show title. Please dress comfortably with correct shoes to move. ABOUT THE SHOW: LITTLE WOMEN: THE MUSICAL Through special arrangements with Music Theatre International (MTI) Music by Jason Howland • Lyrics by Mindi Dickstein • Book by Allan Knee Based on the beloved novel by Louisa May Alcott, Little Women follows the adventures of sisters, Jo, Meg, Beth and Amy March. Jo is determined to become a successful author, but first, she has to learn a few of life’s valuable lessons before discovering her own “astonishing” voice in the world. The powerful score soars with the sounds of personal discovery, heartache and hope! CHARACTERS: (Note: Casting will not be limited to the age range listed of the characters. Character ages are a suggestion and they must look like they visually go together.) Jo March – Female, 16 - 30 Our story’s protagonist. A Passionate and determined young author struggling to find her place in the world. She has the idea of writing Little Women and eventually becomes engaged to Professor Bhaer. Amy March – Female, 15 -26 The youngest, most energetic sister with a rather pompous air about her. She later marries Laurie. Doubles as the Troll in the operatic tragedy. Meg March – Female, 16 - 30 The world-weary, yet hopeful, oldest sister who yearns for a great life. She marries John and has twins with him. Doubles as Clarissa in the operatic tragedy. Beth March – Female, 16 - 30 The second youngest of the sisters. Timid and musical, Beth encourages and helps her sisters selflessly. Forms an unlikely friendship with the crotchety Mr Laurence. Doubles as Rodrigo 2 in the operatic tragedy. Marmee March – Female, 40 - 60 The March girls’ mother. She is the strong backbone of the family, who is courageous in spite of the difficult odds she faces. Doubles as the HAG in the operatic tragedy. Aunt March – Female, 50-70 A formidable, overbearing matron and great-aunt to the March sisters. The wealthy socialite in town. Theodore ‘Laurie’ Laurence – Male, 17 - 30 Lonely and charming boy next door who becomes firm friends with the March family. Proposes to Jo but eventually falls in love with and marries Amy. Doubles as Rodrigo in the operatic tragedy. Mr. John Brooke – Male, 20 - 40 Laurie’s tutor. A reserved and hard-working young man who only shows his tender side when he falls in love with Meg. Doubles as Braxton Prendergast in the operatic tragedy. Professor Bhaer – Male, 30 - 50 A sensible German professor boarding with Mrs Kirk. Persuades Jo that she is better than the “blood and guts stuff” she writes. Falls in love with, and eventually becomes engaged to Jo. Mr. Laurence – Male, 50 - 75 Laurie’s grandfather. A stiff and stern elderly man who eventually shows his softer side and becomes friends with Beth. Mrs. Kirk – Female, 40 - 70 The Irish owner of the boarding house in which Professor Bhaer and Jo meet. Ensemble consisting of singers and dancers to play the following roles: ball attendees, ice skaters, various characters in the Operatic Tragedy, and townspeople. What to expect if you are cast in Little Women: If you are cast, rehearsals may begin as soon as Tuesday, October 20 at 7pm. We typically rehearse from 7pm to 10pm on Mon-Fri, on Saturdays from 10am or 12 noon to 6pm, and 1pm to 6pm on Sundays. During the final week of technical rehearsals, we plan on rehearsing until 11 pm. There may be three times before we begin technical rehearsals that you may be asked to stay until 10:30 PM. Note: Not every cast member will be required to be at every rehearsal. The Director makes sure to create a well organized rehearsal schedule. Your time is very important, and we will try our best to make your time at CVP productive. If cast, your schedule requirements will be based on where you are placed in the show. In order for the Director to work with conflicts it is important that you let her know on your audition application. For this production of Little Women , please check and double check any conflicts you have between Sunday, October 11 through December 13, 2020 and let the Director know at the time of your audition. Thank you! PERFORMANCE DATES FOR LITTLE WOMEN: Friday, November 20 at 7:30 pm Saturday, November 21 at 2 pm  & 7:30 pm Sunday, November 22 at 2 pm * No Performance on Thanksgiving, Nov. 26 Friday, November 27 at 7:30 pm Saturday, November 28 at 2 pm  & 7:30 pm Sunday, November 29 at 2 pm Thursday, December 3 at 7:30 pm Friday, December 4 at 7:30 pm Saturday, December 5 at 2 pm  & 7:30 pm Sunday, December 6 at 2 pm ADDITIONAL POTENTIAL HOLDOVERS/ WHICH MAY OR MAY NOT BE SCHEDULED: Thursday, December 10 at 7:30 pm\ Friday, December 11 at 7:30 pm Saturday, December 12 at 2pm & 7:30 pm Sunday, December 13 at 2 pm & 7:30 pm Main navigation About Us Meet the Team 100th Celebration History Contact Us Business Partners Show History Box Office Ticketing Information Season Subscriptions Seating Chart Plan Your Visit Buy Tickets Online Gift Certificates Donate to the Playhouse Events Broadway on Brevard Spotlight Series Stars of Tomorrow 100th Celebration Auditions College Audition Prep Studio Get Involved Job Opportunities Volunteer Opportunities Audition Information Sponsorship Opportunities The Aladdin Society The Legacy Foundation Student Scholarships The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse, Inc. provides affordable community theatre and promotes lifelong education in the performing arts for Brevard County residents and visitors. Health and Safety Measures | The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse Skip to main content The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse Menu (321) 636-5050 Buy Tickets Gift Account Cart Health and Safety Measures Updated: March 1st As we have done since reopening, we’ve been very intentional and gradual in our approach to our COVID-19 health and safety protocols. Based on recent trends and regulatory guidance, The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse will be making adjustments to these measures, which may continue to change at any time without notice FACE COVERINGS Face coverings are optional for fully vaccinated Guests in both outdoor and indoor locations. We expect Guests who are not fully vaccinated to continue wearing face coverings at all times inside the theatre. PHYSICAL DISTANCING We have reduced distancing guidelines for patrons inside the theatre. Reservations may be directly next to you and parties may be seated directly in front and behind you. It’s important to remember that some experiences may remain temporarily unavailable. CLEANING We will continue the high standards for cleanliness and sanitation we’ve always set for ourselves. All surfaces are sprayed or fogged with industrial antiviral/antibacterial solution prior to and following all performances and events. Hand sanitizer stations will still be available throughout the theatre. Patrons are required to follow all posted signage and staff instructions. COVID-19 WARNING By entering The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse, you are confirming that you and all persons in your party are not experiencing any of the following symptoms of COVID-19 identified by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention at CDC.gov, including: Fever or chills, Cough, Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing, Fatigue, Muscle or body aches, Headache, New loss of taste or smell, Sore throat, Congestion or runny nose, and Nausea or vomiting. Parties are also confirming that all members have not been in contact with someone with confirmed or suspected COVID-19 symptoms without completing a quarantine or are not under any self-quarantine orders. By visiting The Historic Cocoa Village Playhouse you voluntarily assume all risks related to exposure to COVID-19. Thank you for your help in keeping us all safe and for supporting this historic theatre. If you have any questions or need to reschedule your reservation, please call our Ticket Office. Throughout the years the theater has changed the variety of performances from screen movies to musicals to Broadway plays. Known to all as ‘Broadway on Brevard’, local volunteers and staff provide the talent that preserves and maintains the highest professional quality of arts in the country. While waiting for the show to start, plan to come a little early and visit one of the area restaurants or simply take a stroll through the town visiting all the unique stores or even a romantic walk on the riverfront.
